features.title: Feature Usage
content: 1. Set Base Point (Point A):
‚Ä¢ Use the search box to enter a location name or address to search and set the base point
‚Ä¢ Or click on a location on the map to set the base point (only available when no base point is set)
‚Ä¢ Once set, the base point is locked and won't change if you accidentally click on the map
2. Use the filters on the left to set search criteria:
‚Ä¢ Max Distance: Drag the slider or directly enter a value in the input box (100-5000 meters)
‚Ä¢ Min Rating: Drag the slider or directly enter a value (0-5, supports decimals)
‚Ä¢ Price: Select the maximum acceptable price level
‚Ä¢ Categories: Select restaurant types (multiple selection available)
‚Ä¢ Features: Select special requirements (e.g., show only open restaurants)
3. View Filtered Results:
‚Ä¢ Filtered restaurants are displayed on the map and shown in a list at the bottom left
‚Ä¢ Click on restaurant markers or restaurants in the list to view details
‚Ä¢ Clicking on a restaurant won't change the base point
4. Change Base Point:
‚Ä¢ Click the "View Nearby Restaurants" button in restaurant details to change the base point to that restaurant
‚Ä¢ Or use the search box to search for a new location to set the base point
‚Ä¢ Click the "Reset" button to clear all settings (including base point) and start over
5. Other Features:
‚Ä¢ Food Roulette: Randomly select from filtered restaurants
‚Ä¢ Click on empty areas of the map to close restaurant info windows

priceStandard.title: Price Level Standard
priceStandard.content: Price levels are based on Google Places API's price_level setting. Map markers are color-coded by price level:

levels.1: $ - Inexpensive (Green marker üü¢): Usually snacks, street vendors, etc. Average cost around NT$100 or less
levels.2: $$ - Moderate (Yellow marker üü°): General restaurants, cafes, etc. Average cost around NT$100-300
levels.3: $$$ - Expensive (Orange marker üü†): Mid-to-high-end restaurants. Average cost around NT$300-600
levels.4: $$$$ - Very Expensive (Red marker üî¥): High-end restaurants. Average cost around NT$600 or more

ratingStandard.title: Rating Standard
ratingStandard.content: Ratings come from Google Maps user reviews, ranging from 0-5 stars. The system displays average ratings and review counts

distanceStandard.title: Distance Calculation
distanceStandard.content: Distance is calculated using straight-line distance (Haversine formula) in meters or kilometers. Click "View Route" to open Google Maps and see the actual route
